CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1950, pg. 23, reads: " New Harriet Tubman Terrace House...for convalescent Ne...women...This beautiful home for shut-ins, located at 7921 Frankstown Avenue near Oakwood Street, will be rededicated Sunday, Oct. 29...house will be held that day from 10 A.M. until 6 P.M. with special...at 3 P.M. in form of a 'Greenback Shower.' At the ceremony plaques will be unveiled honoring Mrs. Abraham Lincoln president and Mrs. John M. Phillips, honorary president, and Mrs. H.C. McEl...the guild's 'fairy' godmother.  Judge Homer S. Brown will dedicate...plaques.  Judge Lois McBride will be mistress of ceremonies, and Mrs. Daisy L. Lampkin will respond to the welcome address.  Pictured are some of the remodeled views of the Convalescent Home which tell own story...Interior of sun porch which was added during the rebuilding program...Mrs. Calvin Bartlett is president, Mrs. Golden May, chairman of the building committee, and Mrs. Preston Clayton, chairman of endowment.  The home can be reached by cars 88 or 87. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Sun porch of Harriet Tubman Terrace House with snake plants and wicker furniture, 7921 Frankstown Avenue
